pullRequest.title: create default ack_status node for moduleVersion. update portal view url
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR fixes 2 things:

populate default ack_status for moduleVersion. As status-user can't crate node. it can only update ack_status node
pass in variant name to portal view uri

commit.message: create default ack_status node for moduleVersion. update portal view url

nodes.bodyText: hmmm.. since this is the portal view, I thought we said the uuid in the portal url would be the module variant's id (hence making the variant parameter unnecessary)
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -66,7 +66,7 @@ class ModuleDisplay extends Component { {this.state.releaseUpdateDate.trim() !== "" && this.state.releaseUpdateDate !== '-' && this.state.moduleUUID !== "" && this.state.portalHost !== "" - && View on Customer Portal + &&

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure this is where this creation should happen... but perhaps there's no better place. At the very least lets add a comment indicating that we should re-evaluate where this node gets created.
hmmm... I don't think this resource path is valid after the JCR changes.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@ const props = {
     onGetProduct: (productValue) => anymatch,
     onGetVersion: (versionValue) => anymatch,
     productInfo: "Red Hat Enterprise Linux",
-    updateDate: (draftUpdateDate, releaseUpdateDate, releaseVersion, moduleUUID) => anymatch,
+    updateDate: (draftUpdateDate, releaseUpdateDate, releaseVersion, variantUUID) => anymatch,
     variant: "test",
     versionModulePath: "/modules/test/en_US/1"

nodes.bodyText: I would just get rid of the comment
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -102,6 +104,7 @@ protected String getQuery(SlingHttpServletRequest request) {
                     .append("jcr:like(*/*/*/*/metadata/@jcr:title,'%" + searchParam + "%') ")
                     .append("or jcr:like(*/*/*/*/metadata/@jcr:description,'%" + searchParam + "%')")
                     .append("or jcr:like(*/*/*/*/cached_html/jcr:content/@jcr:data,'%" + searchParam + "%')")
+//                    .append("or jcr:like(*/*/source/@jcr:created,'%" + searchParam + "%') ")

nodes.bodyText: instead of this conditional you coul use the traversal api. It would yield cleaner, more concise code.

commit.message: update hydra messages to use the variant api

nodes.bodyText: Not a blocker, but we should add the uuid field to the ModuleVariant model so we can use it.

👍
(you could keep traversing all the way down to the variant name and avoid that null check 😃 )
